page.title: 04Farming on the South Downs
page.content:
Church Farm is typical of the farming on the South Downs. It is a farm of approximately 1900 acres. The land varies in height from 2 metres to 152 metres. The majority of the farm is on the Chalk Downland although parts of it are on the clay soils of the Cuckmere Valley.
Mixed farming is carried out. The farmer has 800 acres of corn and about 50 acres of oil seed rape. The rest of the land is kept for grass. There are 90 dairy cows, 600 young stock and 150 yews.
The farmer favours keeping cattle rather than sheep because he can fence them in more easily,although there is a gradual move back to sheep farming.
